page.title: 11YEADING WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
page.content: The meetings are held on the second Friday of the month in St.Edmunds Church at 7.30 pm. The institute members elect a President and Committee of twelve annually. The first part of the monthly meeting is devoted to the business of the institute. At each meeting a speaker is booked, and their subjects are varied to give members an insight into a wide variety of subjects. Each year a produce show is held when members display their handicrafts. These include knitting, tapestry, toy making and garden produce. Classes are held during the year for the various forms of handicraft. Members support local organisations such as St. Bernards Hospital and League of friends at Hillingdon Hospital. They also take part in the Hillingdon half marathon. Outings are arranged to radio shows.
